Creating accessible navigation

Play Video: Creating accessible navigation
  • 25 June 2025
  • learn

Show Notes:

Examples with JS

Fly-out Menus

From the W3C's Web Accessibility Initiative:

  • Examples with code

Accessible, but not progressively enhanced or very usable on small devices.

Animated nav hidden on mobile

From Manuel Matuzović's Acessibility Cookbook:

  • Example
  • Code

Accessible and fine for small devices, but not progressively enhanced.

progressively enhanced navigation

From Sara Soueidan's Practical Accessibility.

  • Drop-down navigation.
  • Mobile navigation (focus trapped).
  • Mobile navigation (focus NOT trapped).

Here <span> tags are changed to <button> tags when JS loads. The hamburger works as a modal dialog which traps the user within it by default. The last option escape the modal via the last focusable item.

David's note: some years ago I used <dialog> to imitate a mega-menu . Until a month ago, I've not seen anyone using this for navigation menus. It seems to work with only a few lines of JS, but I have not tested it emough to cover here. Improvement is needed.

Simpler Navigation

Even with HTML and CSS there are few things than can be done to make the experience better for all.

  • Example with code
